item.title: Sandra add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "Men, their rights, and nothing more; women, their rights, and nothing less." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Sandra add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "Cautious, careful people, always casting about to preserve their reputation and social standing, never can bring about a reform. Those who are really in earnest must be willing to be anything or nothing in the world's estimation, and publicly and privately, in season and out, avow their sympathy with despised and persecuted ideas and their advocates, and bear the consequences..." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Sandra add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The characteristic of genuine heroism is its persistency. All men have wandering impulses, fits and starts of generosity. But when you have resolved to be great, abide by yourself, and do not weakly try to reconcile yourself with the world. The heroic cannot be the common, nor the common the heroic." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sandra add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sandra add a quote by Gloria Steinem
item.description: "Any woman who chooses to behave like a full human being should be warned that the armies of the status quo will treat her as something of a dirty joke . . . She will need her sisterhood." -- Gloria Steinem
